snippet: The bombers were scheduled for retirement years ago, but they are expected to keep flying until at least 2040.
abstract: Air Force persists in its use of B-52 bombers 60 years after they were introduced into combat, with 76 B-52s making up bulk of United States' long-range bomber fleet; bomber's longevity is due to both its rugged design and flaws in planes meant to replace it; usefulness of cumbersome plane, and bombers in general, is being questioned in modern combat era.
lead_paragraph: The bombers were scheduled for retirement years ago, but they are expected to keep flying until at least 2040.

headline.main: After 60 Years, B-52s Still Dominate U.S. Fleet
headline.print_headline: Slow and Rusted, but Still Flying

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
